conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, or G) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles, we need to analyze the flow paths from each inlet (A, B, C, and D) to the outlets.
Inlet A: The liquid flows down and to the left, passing through the green baffle.
Inlet A: The liquid continues downward and to the left, entering container E.
Inlet B: The liquid flows down and to the right, passing through the gray baffle.
Inlet B: The liquid continues downward and to the right, entering container F.
Inlet C: The liquid flows down and to the right, passing through the purple baffle.
Inlet C: The liquid continues downward and to the right, entering container G.
Inlet D: The liquid flows down and to the left, passing through the pink baffle.
Inlet D: The liquid continues downward and to the left, entering container E.

premise: Inlet A: Container E; Inlet B: Container F; Inlet C: Container G; Inlet D: Container E
conclusion: The liquid from inlets A and D will flow into container E, the liquid from inlet B will flow into container F, and the liquid from inlet C will flow into container G.
